summary: The Port Security Grant Program awarded $690 million for response vessels, surveillance cameras, cybersecurity, and more in 82 U.S. ports over the past 7 years. Private and public sector organizations may apply for the grants, which can fund projects to protect people and infrastructure from terrorism. The Federal Emergency Management Agency works with the Coast Guard to administer the program. FEMA has a process to...
title: Port Security: FEMA Should Improve Transparency of Grant Decisions
